clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Saccharomyces Boulardii and Nystatin Prophylaxis on Candida Colonization and Infection in Very Low Birth Weight Infants

lead_sponsor.agency: Zekai Tahir Burak Women's Health Research and Education Hospital

clinical_study.source: Zekai Tahir Burak Women's Health Research and Education Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Probiotics are favorable microorganisms that regulate the flora of the gastrointestinal system and stimulate the immune system. Saccharomyces boulardii was shown to reduce candida colonization. The objective of this study is to evaluate the efficacy of prophylactic S boulardii in reducing the candida colonization and infection in very low birth weight infants.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of prophylactic S. boulardii and nystatin on candida colonization and infection in very low birth weight infants

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of S. boulardii on sepsis

clinical_study.condition: Anticandidal Property of Saccharomyces Boulardii on Very Low Birth Weight Infants

arm_group.description: The patients in this group will be given 5 million unit/day S. boulardii until discharge.

intervention.description: 5 million unit/day, orally, beginning on the second day of life, until discharge from hospital
50000 unit/3 times a day, both for orally and by orogastric route

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Very low birth weight infants < 1500 gr
Exclusion Criteria:
- Genetic anomalies
- Not willing to participate
- Allergy to S. boulardii components
